intro: Ananas pyramidalis, commonly known as the pineapple guava, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spiky leaves that form a rosette around the stem. The plant produces a fragrant, edible fruit that resembles a small pineapple in appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and appear at the center of the leaf rosette. Ananas pyramidalis thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid climate for optimal growth.
